ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Anyone interested in improving and expanding their research skills, particularly in Early Modern British history, should take this course.

I would recommend it as a great way to learn a process of writing research papers and as an introduction to early modern British historiography. In recommending this class, I would emphasize that Professor Pincus has a very particular way of conducting research and does not encourage finding other ways to go about it. That being said, his method is absolutely worth learning, even if it is not a way that works for you or your larger research projects. For instance, I think his process is an excellent blueprint for my further research, though I may not follow it step by step.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
